newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends steady-up on CBOT gain.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends steady-up on CBOT gain.

text.p: WCE canola futures closed steady to higher, partially supported by gains in CBOT soybean futures, traders said. Feed grains closed slightly lower on anticipation of hedge selling.

Also featured in canola was buying of March futures at $410 and March $410 call options, which sources said would be a profitable trade. Canola traders also traded new-crop crush spreads by buying September and November canola and selling deferred CBOT soyoil futures.
Canola closed unchanged to up $1.50 per ton with March unchanged at $409.20.
Flaxseed was lightly traded with speculative selling against light commercial buying. Flaxseed closed down $3.00 to unchanged with March off the most at $351.20.
Wheat and barley futures ended down pressured by warmer weather in the Prairies. Warm weather should prompt greater grain movement as farmers will be more willing to load trucks.
Wheat ended down $0.50 to steady with March off the most at $170.20 a tonne.
Barley fell C$0.80 to C$0.20 with February off C$0.40 at C$138.70. March oats closed up US$0.50 at US$120.00 and February feed peas fell US$1.00 to US$207.00.
(Late Wednesday the Canadian dollar was at C$1.3454).
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
